page.title: 19GERALD HOWARTH M.P.1.
page.content: Robert Leadbeater. On Sunday 30th June Robin Budinac,Paul Jones and myself went for an interview with the M.P. for Burntwood and Cannock,Gerald Howarth.We asked him 12 questions about his job and duties. Gerald Howarth represents 70,000 people over the age of 18 that live in Burntwood and Cannock area.He is one of 650 M.P's in the U.K..He was elected to Parliament in June 1983. His job involves taking part in the great national debates in the Houses of Parliament.All sorts of things are brought before Parliament. Gerald Howarth's job is very complicated.This is a typical day:- The first thing that he does is to open the post to see what people have written about.People write to him about all sorts of things.They write in to tell him their ideas and problems.
